title: How to Add Stickers on Discord: Steps for PC & Mac

steps.title: Navigate to a server where you want to add stickers.
steps.content: Navigate to a server where you want to add stickers. You must have Expression permissions to add stickers to a server. If you don't have permission to add stickers to a server, you will need to get them from an admin. To grant Expression permissions, navigate to Server Settings . Click on the Roles menu item on the left and select the role you'd like to edit. Click on the Permissions tab and toggle on Create Expressions and Manage Expressions under General Server Permissions .

steps.title: Click on the server name in the top left of the screen.
steps.content: Click on the server name in the top left of the screen. This will expand the menu for the server you're in.

steps.title: Click on Stickers.
steps.content: Click on Stickers . This menu item is near the top of the server settings menu, between Emoji and Soundboard .

steps.title: Click the blue Upload Sticker button.
steps.content: Click the blue Upload Sticker button. Every server gets 5 free sticker slots. To unlock more, the server needs to be boosted. Servers get a total of 15 sticker slots at Level 1, 30 sticker slots at Level 2, and 60 sticker slots at Level 3.

steps.title: Upload a sticker.
steps.content: Upload a sticker. Click the blue Browse button under File to add a sticker. The sticker should be in PNG, APNG, or GIF format, and should not be larger than 512kb. Discord will show you a preview of what the sticker will look like in both dark and light mode.

steps.title: Add a related emoji.
steps.content: Add a related emoji. Discord links each sticker to an emoji to help suggest various stickers to users when they're looking for a different emoji. For example, if you want to send an angry emoji, Discord will suggest custom stickers that could also convey your angry emotions. Both unicode and custom emojis can be assigned.

steps.title: Add a description.
steps.content: Add a description. This is an optional step, but adding a description helps users with screen readers know what the sticker looks like without having to see it. A good description is concise and describes what the sticker looks like and the emotion it conveys.

steps.title: Click the blue Upload button when you're happy with the sticker.
steps.content: Click the blue Upload button when you're happy with the sticker. The sticker will be uploaded to the server and will be available for immediate use.

steps.title: There is currently no way to add stickers on the Discord app.
steps.content: There is currently no way to add stickers on the Discord app. You can upload emojis on the Discord app, but there is no option to add stickers as of right now. You will either have to wait to add your sticker until you're on a computer, or you'll have to ask someone else with Expression permissions to add the sticker for you. You can still use stickers in your messages on the Discord app.

steps.title: Go to the server that has the sticker you want to edit.
steps.content: Go to the server that has the sticker you want to edit.

steps.title: Navigate to the Stickers menu.
steps.content: Navigate to the Stickers menu. You can find this by clicking the server name in the top left corner and going to Server Settings .

steps.title: Hover the sticker you want to edit and click the pencil icon.
steps.content: Hover the sticker you want to edit and click the pencil icon. You can edit the sticker's associated emoji, name, and description in the window that pops up. You cannot change a sticker file after it's been uploaded. If you need to edit the sticker file, you have to delete the sticker and reupload it. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Go to the server that has the sticker you want to edit.
steps.content: Go to the server that has the sticker you want to edit.

steps.title: Navigate to the Stickers menu.
steps.content: Navigate to the Stickers menu. You can find this by clicking the server name in the top left corner and going to Server Settings .

steps.title: Hover the sticker you want to edit and click the red X icon.
steps.content: Hover the sticker you want to edit and click the red X icon. Be sure you're deleting the correct sticker, as Discord does not give you a confirmation pop up once you hit the red X.

steps.title: Open the sticker window.
steps.content: Open the sticker window. This interface lists all the stickers you can send. On PC or Mac, select the sticker icon on the right side of the message field. The sticker icon looks like a piece of paper with a smile and is between the GIF and emoji icons. On mobile, select the emoji icon on the right side of the message field. Then, swap to the Stickers tab. Alternatively, you can start typing a phrase between colons to bring up the emoji menu, which will also suggest relevant stickers.

steps.title: Select a sticker to send it.
steps.content: Select a sticker to send it. Once you click or tap on a sticker, it will send immediately. To send stickers from other servers, you must have Discord Nitro . You can send stickers without restriction on the Basic or full Nitro plans.

steps.content: You can find stickers on database sites like StickersGG . Scroll through and download a wide variety of stickers to meet any and all of your serverâ€™s needs. Emoji.gg is another great resource for this. Stickers from these sites will automatically be the correct size for Discord.
